comments.author: andrebargull@googlemail.com
comments.body:
No longer reproducible in current master, also see change [1]. Bug report can be closed.

[1] https://github.com/mozilla/rhino/commit/366d7cf534d83c31eedb9b49234c9388e3caefc7

description:
Created attachment 560269
Chapter15_Object_defineProperty.java

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.2
Build ID: 20110902133214

Steps to reproduce:

Called "Object.defineProperty()" resp. "Object.defineProperties()" with an accessor descriptor which includes an accessor ("get" or "set") which is explicitly set to "undefined". 

See test262 for the original test case:
test/suite/ietestcenter/chapter15/15.2/15.2.3/15.2.3.6/15.2.3.6-3-231.js
test/suite/ietestcenter/chapter15/15.2/15.2.3/15.2.3.6/15.2.3.6-3-261.js


Actual results:

Subsequent [[Get]] or [[Put]] operations now lead to a "java.lang.ClassCastException: org.mozilla.javascript.Undefined cannot be cast to org.mozilla.javascript.Function" exception.


Expected results:

Accessor descriptors should allow "undefined" as a valid entry per ES5 spec.
summary: Accessor descriptor with accessor set explicitly to "undefined" throws ClassCastException
